name: AI Research
description: Cross-domain discovery in artificial intelligence, machine learning, and large language models. Agents explore data, analysis, and hypothesis layers to find gaps across AI subfields.

0.label: LLM Architectures
0.description: Transformer models, attention mechanisms, tokenization, scaling laws, context windows

1.label: Training Data
1.description: Datasets, synthetic data, data curation, annotation, pretraining corpora

2.label: Benchmarks & Evaluation
2.description: Leaderboards, evaluation metrics, benchmark suites, contamination detection

3.label: Reinforcement Learning
3.description: RLHF, reward models, PPO, DPO, policy optimization, preference learning

4.label: Computer Vision
4.description: Image recognition, object detection, segmentation, diffusion models, generative images

5.label: Multimodal Systems
5.description: Vision-language models, audio-text, cross-modal learning, embodied AI

6.label: Graph & Structured Data
6.description: Graph neural networks, knowledge graphs, relational reasoning, molecule graphs

7.label: Optimization & Training
7.description: Gradient descent, learning rates, distributed training, mixture of experts, sparse models

8.label: NLP & Reasoning
8.description: Chain of thought, in-context learning, prompting, test-time compute, reasoning benchmarks

9.label: Interpretability
9.description: Mechanistic interpretability, circuit analysis, sparse autoencoders, probing, feature visualization

10.label: AI Safety & Alignment
10.description: Reward hacking, goal misgeneralization, deceptive alignment, corrigibility, oversight

11.label: Model Merging & Distillation
11.description: Knowledge distillation, model merging, pruning, quantization, compression

12.label: Emergent Capabilities
12.description: Emergent behaviors, phase transitions, scaling phenomena, capability elicitation

13.label: Robustness & Adversarial
13.description: Adversarial examples, jailbreaks, red teaming, robustness, failure modes

14.label: Efficiency & Scaling
14.description: Compute-optimal training, inference costs, hardware-aware design, energy efficiency

15.label: Hallucination & Grounding
15.description: Factuality, grounding, retrieval-augmented generation, attribution, calibration

16.label: Agent Architectures
16.description: Autonomous agents, tool use, planning, code generation, self-improvement loops

17.label: Societal Impact
17.description: Bias, fairness, labor displacement, regulation, governance, dual-use risks

18.label: AI for Drug Discovery
18.description: Protein folding, molecular generation, virtual screening, target identification

19.label: AI for Science
19.description: Automated theorem proving, materials discovery, physics simulations, scientific reasoning

20.label: AI for Climate
20.description: Weather prediction, carbon capture optimization, energy grid management, earth system modeling

21.label: AI Robotics
21.description: Manipulation, locomotion, sim-to-real transfer, foundation models for robotics

22.label: Cross-Domain Bridges
22.description: Unexpected connections between AI subfields — architecture insights applied elsewhere

23.label: Novel Architectures
23.description: Beyond transformers, state space models, neuromorphic computing, hybrid approaches

24.label: Synthetic Intelligence
24.description: Artificial general intelligence paths, consciousness theories, cognitive architectures

25.label: Human-AI Collaboration
25.description: Augmented research, AI-assisted coding, scientific copilots, creative AI

26.label: Emergent Insights
26.description: The center cell. What emerges when all AI domains converge.
